entries.quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent. It takes a touch of genius ̶ and a lot of courage ̶ to move in the opposite direction.
entries.author: Albert Einstein

entries.quote: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
entries.author: Mae West

entries.quote: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.
entries.author: Hedy Lamarr

entries.quote: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
entries.author: Mark Twain

entries.quote: Donʼt be so humble - you are not that great.
entries.author: Golda Meir

entries.quote: I do not know the American gentleman, God forgive me for putting two such words together.
entries.author: Charles Dickens

entries.quote: What a kid I got, I told him about the birds and the bees and he told me about the butcher and my wife.
entries.author: Rodney Dangerfield

entries.quote: A stockbroker urged me to buy a stock that would triple its value every year. I told him, “At my age, I donʼt even buy green bananas.”
entries.author: Claude Pepper

entries.quote: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. Thatʼs relativity.
entries.author: Albert Einstein

entries.quote: A committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours.
entries.author: Milton Berle

entries.quote: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.
entries.author: Lana Turner

entries.quote: Do not worry about avoiding temptation. As you grow older it will avoid you.
entries.author: Joey Adams

entries.quote: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. Sheʼs ninety-seven now, and we donʼt know where the hell she is.
entries.author: Ellen DeGeneres

entries.quote: Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and, instead of bleeding, he sings.
entries.author: Robert Benchley

entries.quote: I can tell if two people are in love by how they hold each otherʼs hands, and how thick their sanitation gloves are.
entries.author: Jarod Kintz

entries.quote: You know, sometimes kids get bad grades in school because the class moves too slow for them. Einstein got Dʼs in school. Well guess what, I get Fʼs!!!
entries.author: Bill Watterson

entries.quote: Electricity is actually made up of extremely tiny particles called electrons, that you cannot see with the naked eye unless you have been drinking.
entries.author: Dave Barry

entries.quote: Politicians and diapers have one thing in common. They should both be changed regularly, and for the same reason.
entries.author: José Maria de Eça de Queiroz

entries.quote: Some cause happiness wherever they go; others whenever they go.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: When I was a boy of fourteen, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one, I was astonished at how much he had learned in seven years.
entries.author: Mark Twain

entries.quote: Nothing sucks more than that moment during an argument when you realize youʼre wrong.
entries.author: Unknown

entries.quote: My computer beat me at checkers, but I sure beat it at kickboxing.
entries.author: Emo Philips

entries.quote: I donʼt hate yoṳ I just donʼt like that you exist.
entries.author: Gena Showalter

entries.quote: Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot.
entries.author: Groucho Marx

entries.quote: I found there was only one way to look thin: hang out with fat people.
entries.author: Rodney Dangerfield

entries.quote: A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree.
entries.author: Spike Milligan

entries.quote: I havenʼt spoken to my wife in years. I didnʼt want to interrupt her.
entries.author: Rodney Dangerfield

entries.quote: The secret to staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
entries.author: Lucille Ball

entries.quote: I couldnʼt repair your brakes, so I made your horn louder.
entries.author: Steven Wright

entries.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: You have enemies? Good. That means youʼve stood up for something, sometime in your life.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: If you are going through hell, keep going.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A fanatic is one who canʼt change his mind and wonʼt change the subject.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Donʼt interrupt me while Iʼm interrupting.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: There is no such thing as a good tax.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: The greatest lesson in life is to know that even fools are right sometimes.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile ̶ hoping it will eat him last.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A joke is a very serious thing.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: We are all worms, But I do believe that I am a glow worm.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: To improve is to change; to be perfect is to change often.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Personally Iʼm always ready to learn, although I do not always like being taught.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: War is a game that is played with a smile. If you canʼt smile, grin. If you canʼt grin, keep out of the way till you can.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: You will never reach your destination if you stop and throw stones at every dog that barks.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: We contend that for a nation to tax itself into prosperity is like a man standing in a bucket and trying to lift himself up by the handle.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Politics is the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didnʼt happen.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Never, never, never give up.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A small lie needs a bodyguard of bigger lies to protect it.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Battles are won by slaughter and maneuver. The greater the general, the more he contributes in maneuver, the less he demands in slaughter.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: If Hitler invaded hell I would make at least a favorable reference to the devil in the House of Commons.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Danger: if you meet it promptly and without flinching, you will reduce the danger by half. Never run away from anything. Never!
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kil him.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: If we open a quarrel between past and present, we shall find that we have lost the future.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: A good speech should be like a womanʼs skirt: long enough to cover the subject and short enough to create interest.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: When you have to kill a man it costs nothing to be polite.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Always remember, that I have taken more out of alcohol than alcohol has taken out of me.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: When there is no enemy within, the enemies outside cannot hurt you.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: If youʼre not a liberal at twenty you have no heart, if youʼre not a conservative at forty, you have no brain.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: You make a living by what you get. You make a life by what you give.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: He who dares, wins.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Continuous effort! not strength or intelligence, is the key to unlocking your potential.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Sometimes our best is simply not enough. We have to do what is required.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: I do not see any other way of realizing our hopes about World Organization in five or six days. Even the Almighty took seven.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: Donʼt talk to me about naval tradition. Itʼs nothing but rum, sodomy, and the lash.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: There is no time for ease and comfort. It is the time to dare and endure.
entries.author: Winston Churchill

entries.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Time is very slow for those who wait, Very fast for those who are scared, Very long for those who lament, Very short for those who celebrate, But for those who love, time is eternal.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: There is nothing either good or bad, but thinking makes it so.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: If you love and get hurt, love more. If you love more and hurt more, love even more. If you love even more and get hurt even more, love some more until it hurts no more̤.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Nothing will come of nothing; we must dare mighty things.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: A light heart lives long.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Neither a borrower nor a lender be: For loan oft loses both itself and friend. ʼTis an ill cook that cannot lick his own fingers.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Brevity is the soul of wit.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: O thou invisible spirit of wine, if thou hast no name to be known by, let us call thee devil.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: When sorrows come, they come not single spies, But in battalions.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: The course of true love never did run smooth.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Love is heavy and light, bright and dark, hot and cold, sick and healthy, asleep and awake ̶ its everything except what it is!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Beware the ides of March.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: The object of Art is to give life a shape.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Love me or hate me, both are in my favor̤. If you love me, Iʼll always be in your heart̤. If you hate me, Iʼll always be in your mind.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Expectation is the root of all heartache.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Love is the greatest of dreams, yet the worst of nightmares.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Allʼs well if all ends well.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: One may smile, and smile, and be a villain.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Nothing will come of nothing: speak again.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Whatʼs done cannot be undone.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: A young woman in love always looks like patience on a monument smiling at grief.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Peopleʼs good deeds we write in water. The evil deeds are etched in brass.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: When we are born, we cry that we are come to this great stage of fools.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Better a witty fool, than a foolish wit.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: There are three people in yourself: Who people think you are, Who you think you really are.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Men have died from time to time, and worms have eaten them, but not for love.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Go to your bosom; Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: I wish my horse had the speed of your tongue.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: What a piece of work is a man!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: How noble in reason! How infinite in faculties!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: In form and moving, how express and admirable!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: In action how like an angel!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: In apprehension how like a god!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: The beauty of the world!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: The paragon of animals!
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: And yet, to me, what is this quintessence of dust?
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: I must be cruel only to be kind; Thus bad begins, and worse remains behind.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Parting is such sweet sorrow that I shall say goodnight till it be morrow.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Hell is empty and all the devils are here.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Life is as tedious as twice-told tale, vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Fishes live in the sea, as men do a̶land; the great ones eat up the little ones.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Speak low, if you speak love.
entries.author: William Shakespeare

entries.quote: Coming together is a beginning. Keeping together is progress. Working together is success.
entries.author: Henry Ford

entries.quote: Alone we can do so little; together we can do so much.
entries.author: Helen Keller

entries.quote: Talent wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
entries.author: Michael Jordan

entries.quote: Teamwork is the secret that make common people achieve uncommon result.
entries.author: Ifeanyi Enoch

entries.quote: If two men on the same job agree all the time, then one is useless. If they disagree all the time, both are useless.
entries.author: Darryl F. Zanuck

entries.quote: None of us is as smart as all of us.
entries.author: Ken Blanchard

entries.quote: Do you want a collection of brilliant minds or a brilliant collection of minds?
entries.author: R. Meredith Belbin

entries.quote: Teams share the burden and divide the grief.
entries.author: Doug Smith

entries.quote: No one can whistle a symphony. It takes an orchestra to play it.
entries.author: H.E. Luccock

entries.quote: The best teamwork comes from men who are working independently toward one goal in unison.
entries.author: James Cash Penney

entries.quote: When you start out in a team, you have to get the teamwork going and then you get something back.
entries.author: Michael Schumacher

entries.quote: Unity is strength̤. when there is teamwork and collaboration, wonderful things can be achieved.
entries.author: Mattie Stepanek

entries.quote: When you score a goal, or hit a three, or get a touchdown, you donʼt do it for yourself, you do it for the team cause the name in the front of the shirt is more important than the one on the back.
entries.author: Anon.

entries.quote: Teamwork divides the task and multiplies the success.
entries.author: Anon

entries.quote: Contrary to popular belief, there most certainly is an “I”in “team.”It is the same “I”that appears three times in “responsibility.”
entries.author: Amber Harding

entries.quote: Remember upon the conduct of each depends the fate of all.
entries.author: Alexander the Great

entries.quote: If you want to build a ship, donʼt drum up people together to collect wood and donʼt assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
entries.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

entries.quote: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.
entries.author: Casey Stengel

entries.quote: The achievements of an organization are the results of the combined effort of each individual.
entries.author: Vince Lombardi

entries.quote: We are only as strong as we are united, as weak as we are divided.
entries.author: J.K. Rowling

entries.quote: All for one and one for all.
entries.author: Alexandre Dumas

entries.quote: A hand fought best when it made a fist.
entries.author: Guy Gavriel

entries.quote: The reason why the world lacks unity, and lies broken and in heaps, is, because man is disunited with himself.
entries.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

entries.quote: Build for your team a feeling of oneness, of dependence on one another and of strength to be derived by unity.
entries.author: Vince Lombardi

entries.quote: Effective teamwork is all about making a good, well-balanced salad not whipping individuals into a single batch of V8.
entries.author: Sandra Richardson

entries.quote: Without forgiveness, there can be no real freedom to act within a group.
entries.author: Max DePree

entries.quote: The greater danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
entries.author: Michelangelo

entries.quote: Success seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they donʼt quit.
entries.author: Conrad Hilton

entries.quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
entries.author: Mark Twain

entries.quote: For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why not now?
entries.author: James Allen

entries.quote: Impossible is a word to be found only in the dictionary of fools.
entries.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

entries.quote: It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed.
entries.author: Theodore Roosevelt

entries.quote: I cannot give you the formula for success, but I can give you the formula for failure which is, try to please everybody.
entries.author: Herbert Swope

entries.quote: Sweat plus sacrifice equals success.
entries.author: Charles O. Finley

entries.quote: Put your heart, mind, intellect and soul even to your smallest acts. That is the secret to success.
entries.author: Swami Sivananda

entries.quote: Success is a journey, not a destination.
entries.author: Ben Sweetland

entries.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
entries.author: Chinese proverb

entries.quote: You just canʼt beat the person who never gives up.
entries.author: Babe Ruth

entries.quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, “Whatʼs in it for me?”
entries.author: Brian Tracy

entries.quote: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.
entries.author: Theodore Roosevelt

entries.quote: I donʼt measure a manʼs success by how high he climbs but how high he bounces when he hits bottom.
entries.author: George Patton

entries.quote: In order to succeed you must fail so that you know what not to do the next time.
entries.author: Anthony J. DʼAngelo

entries.quote: People who are afraid to fail can never experience the joys of success.
entries.author: Pete Zafra

entries.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
entries.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

entries.quote: Success is doing ordinary things extraordinarily well.
entries.author: Jim Rohn

entries.quote: I donʼt know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.
entries.author: Bill Cosby

entries.quote: The greatest barrier to success is the fear of failure.
entries.author: Sven Goran Eriksson

entries.quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
entries.author: Theodore Roosevelt

entries.quote: Try to become not a man of success, but try rather to become a man of value.
entries.author: Albert Einstein

entries.quote: Many of lifeʼs failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
entries.author: Thomas Edison

entries.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to success is more important than any other thing.
entries.author: Abraham Lincoln

entries.quote: Success often comes to those who dare to act. It seldom goes to the timid who are ever afraid of the consequences.
entries.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

entries.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Strong minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, weak minds discuss people.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: By all means marry; if you get a good wife, youʼll become happy; if you get a bad one, youʼll become a philosopher.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The only good is knowledge and the only evil is ignorance.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Be slow to fall into friendship, but when you are in, continue firm and constant.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Sometimes you put walls up not to keep people out, but to see who cares enough to break them down.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: I am not an Athenian nor a Greek, but a citizen of the world.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: When the debate is lost, slander becomes the tool of the loser.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other menʼs writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: To move the world we must move ourselves.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heartʼs desire; the other is to get it.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: All menʼs souls are immortal, but the souls of the righteous are immortal and divine.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Be as you wish to seem.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: No man undertakes a trade he has not learned, even the meanest; yet every one thinks himself sufficiently qualified for the hardest of all trades ̶ that of government.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Remember, no human condition is ever permanent. Then you will not be overjoyed in good fortune nor too scornful in misfortune.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The hour of departure has arrived and we go our ways; I to die, and you to live.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Which is better? Only God knows.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: False words are not only evil in themselves, but they infect the soul with evil.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: From the deepest desires often come the deadliest hate.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Call no man unhappy until he is married.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The hottest love has the coldest end.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: If a man is proud of his wealth, he should not be praised until it is known how he employs it.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: The poets are only the interpreters of the Gods.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Happiness is unrepentant pleasure.
entries.author: Socrates

entries.quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The pure and simple truth is rarely pure and never simple.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The books that the world calls immoral are books that show the world its own shame.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: You can never be overdressed or overeducated.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: I donʼt want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: I am so clever that sometimes I donʼt understand a single word of what I am saying.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: A good friend will always stab you in the front.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone elseʼs opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Every saint has a past, and every sinner has a future.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Experience is merely the name men gave to their mistakes.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Never love anyone who treats you like youʼre ordinary.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: I can resist anything except temptation.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: A manʼs face is his autobiography. A womanʼs face is her work of fiction.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: I choose my friends for their good looks, my acquaintances for their good characters, and my enemies for their good intellects.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Humanity takes itself too seriously. It is the worldʼs original sin. If the cave-man had known how to laugh, History would have been different.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: When the gods wish to punish us, they answer our prayers.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: My own business always bores me to death; I prefer other peopleʼs.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: What is a cynic? A man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The critic has to educate the public; the artist has to educate the critic.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The Americans are certainly hero-worshippers, and always take their heroes from the criminal classes.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: If you pretend to be good, the world takes you very seriously. If you pretend to be bad, it doesnʼt. Such is the astounding stupidity of optimism.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise theyʼll kill you.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: A man can be happy with any woman as long as he does not love her.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: No man is rich enough to buy back his past.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: One should always be in love. That is the reason one should never marry.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: It is always a silly thing to give advice, but to give good advice is fatal.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Pessimist: One who, when he has the choice of two evils, chooses both.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: There is no necessity to separate the monarch from the mob; all authority is equally bad.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: The moment you think you understand a great work of art, itʼs dead for you.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Men always want to be a womanʼs first love ̶ women like to be a manʼs last romance.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Democracy means simply the bludgeoning of the people by the people for the people.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: It is better to be beautiful than to be good. But. it is better to be good than to be ugly.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde

entries.quote: To expect the unexpected shows a thoroughly modern intellect.
entries.author: Oscar Wilde
